definition: "sage of poetry", epithet of Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poem/CL:首[shou3]/poetry/verse
holy/sacred/saint/sage

sentences.english: Of the many Chinese poets in Tang Dynasty, who was known as the "Saint of Poetry"?
sentences.chinese: 中國唐朝詩人輩出，請問被稱爲“詩聖”的是哪一位？

sentences.english: O master poet, I have sat down at thy feet.
sentences.chinese: 呵，詩聖，我已經拜倒在你的腳前。

definition: "immortal of poetry", epithet of Li Bai 李白[Li3 Bai2]
to pass on the light of Buddha
to praise/to compliment
toil/hard work
great calligraphy master/the Sage of Calligraphy, traditional reference to Wang Xizhi 王羲之[Wang2 Xi1 zhi1] (303-361)
respect for the wise
to move and inspire
to praise
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
Su Wu (140-60 BC), Han Dynasty diplomat and statesman, regarded as a model of courage and faithful service
to touch base matter and turn it to gold (idiom); fig. to turn crude writing into a literary gem
conclusion/judgment/verdict
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
high as the mountain and long as the river (idiom); fig. noble and far-reaching
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
